snippet: While the image of Governor Christie of New Jersey is that of a populist Everyman preaching austerity, he has long indulged luxury tastes, sometimes in ethically questionable situations.
abstract: New Jersey Gov Chris Christie, navigating a 2016 presidential bid, has a longstanding taste for expensive travel and accommodations that could undercut his image as an austerity-minded everyman; Christie's tendency to allow wealthy contributors to foot the bill has also placed him in ethical quandaries, especially in cases where they stood to benefit from his political power; analysis of several trips taken by governor given.

byline.original: By KATE ZERNIKE and MICHAEL BARBARO

lead_paragraph: While the image of Governor Christie of New Jersey is that of a populist Everyman preaching austerity, he has long indulged luxury tastes, sometimes in ethically questionable situations.

headline.main: Chris Christie Shows Fondness for Luxury Benefits When Others Pay the Bill
headline.print_headline: In Christie’s Career, Fondness for Luxury Travel
